content.text: Bash was developed in 1989 by Brian Fox.

content.text: Bash was created as a free replacement for the Bourne shell. It quickly became the default for GNU and many Linux systems.

content.text: Over time, Bash added features from other shells, such as the Korn shell (ksh) and C shell (csh), and it became a very versatile tool for command-line users.
